medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Proband 1, a 29-year-old healthy white man, was found to have splenomegaly on routine examination. Proband 2, a 49-year-old healthy white man, was also found to have splenomegaly on routine examination. Both presented with mildly elevated serum triglycerides prior to splenectomy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Proband 1 had a heterozygous LPL Asn2913Ser mutation and family members with cardiovascular disease. Proband 2 had a history of splenomegaly and thrombocytopenia; both had French-Canadian ancestry. The mother of proband 1 had type 2 diabetes and ischemic heart disease.
medical_history.family_history: There was a strong family history of cardiovascular disease, including the mother of proband 1 who had the same apoE defect.
medical_history.social_history: Alcohol intake was minimal. Both probands had no evidence of smoking or drug use; living conditions and occupation were not specified.
